greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: L(p) modulo p^2, where p = prime(n) and L is a Lucas number (A000032).
comment: Lemma 7 from the Andrejic paper (p. 42): Prime p is a Wall-Sun-Sun prime iff L(p) == 1 (mod p^2). Therefore, a(n) = 1 iff A113650(n) = 0.
link: Felix Fröhlich, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
V. Andrejic, On Fibonacci powers, Publikacije Elektrotehnickog fakulteta - serija: matematika, 17 (2006), 38-44.
formula: a(n) = A180363(n) mod A001248(n). - _Michel Marcus_, Feb 09 2016
program: (MAGMA) [Lucas(p) mod p^2: p in PrimesUpTo(250)]; // _Bruno Berselli_, Feb 09 2016
results.author: _Felix Fröhlich_, Feb 05 2016
